revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Mahmoud Khayami | image = Mahmoud Khayami.png | caption = | birth_date = {{birth year and age|1930|01}} | birth_place = [[Mashhad]], [[Iran]] | residence = [[Los Angeles]] | nationality = [[Iranian peoples|Iranian]] | citizenship = [[France|French]] | alma_mater = | occupation = [[Businessman]] and [[philanthropist]] and [[Industrialist]] | spouse = Zahra Seyedi Rashti | children = 5 | parents = Hajd Ali Akbar Khayami | relatives = Ahmad Khayami | website = | signature = | networth = {{increase}} UK£ 140 [[1000000 (number)|million]] }} '''Mahmoud Khayami''', [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]], [[Order of St. Sylvester|KSS]], [[Royal Order of Francis I|GCFO]] ({{lang-fa|محمود خيامی}}) born 1930 in [[Mashhad]], [[Iran]], is an [[Iranian people|Iranian]] industrialist and philanthropist, of French nationality.
==Life== Mahmoud Khayami was born in 1930 in Mashhad where he attended elementary and high school. In 1951 he transferred to Tehran and before long he was involved in the automotive industry. Eleven years later he inaugurated the Iran National company in partnership with his brother, Ahmad Khayami (who later formed a separate company : Kourosh Department Stores). Iran National was destined to become the largest industrial complex in Iran, today known as Iran Khodro or IKCO.
One of the leading champions of Iran's industrialization of the 1960s-70s, he began the production of the popular Peykan cars in 1967, based on cooperation with the Hillman-Hunter company of England which provided the model for it. By 1979, 100,000 cars were produced annually with approximately 44 percent of the parts manufactured in Iran. By 1979 Iran National and its affiliated enterprises employed over 20,000 workers in Tehran, Mashhad and Tabriz.
Although Khayami has retired, his family is still involved in the automotive industry, primarily in dealership ownership of one of their previous international partners [[Mercedes-Benz]], most notably in [[Berkshire]], England and [[Southern California]] where they operate Mercedes-Benz of Anaheim in the city of [[Anaheim]], [[Orange County, California|Orange County]].
In later life, Mahmoud Khayami has been active as a [[philanthropist]] and collector of fine [[Iranian art|Persian art]], forming the '''Khayami Collection'''. He has promoted of inter-religious relations in the UK and internationally with a special emphasis on relations between the Jewish, Christian and Muslim communities. Among his activities have been the hosting at Chatham House ([[Chatham House|RIIA]]) of inter-religious conferences. He is involved with the ''[[Encyclopædia Iranica]]'' project, and chairs the board of editors.
He now splits his time between the United Kingdom, the United States, and France, having been forced to leave Iran at the time of the [[Iranian Revolution|1979 revolution]]. {{Citation needed|date=December 2007}} Khayami is resident in the UK for over 20 years and has never returned to Iran. His philanthropic work (now performed largely through the [https://web.archive.org/web/20070607212646/http://www.thekhayamifoundation.org/ Khayami Foundation]) was recognised in 2004 when he was invested as a Knight of the Pontifical Order of Pope Saint Sylvester by Pope [[John Paul II]], and in 2006 when he was invested as a Knight Commander of the [[Royal Order of Francis I]] by the [[Prince Carlo, Duke of Castro]]. He has also been decorated by the late [[King Hussein of Jordan]] {{Citation needed|date=December 2007}}.
It was announced by the Department of Education and Skills in 2005 that Mr Khayami had become a sponsor of the UK Government's [[Academy (England)|Academy]] programme and had sponsored two academies which will open in [[Sheffield]] during 2007. Both academies will be run by a leading Anglican Church School Trust. It is well known that he is a friend of [[Tony Blair]] whom he has met on a number of occasions. {{Citation needed|date=December 2007}}. He was appointed by The Queen as an Honorary [[CBE]] in 2011 for services to education.
He appeared in the 2008 [[Sunday Times Rich List]].
==Labour party donations== On 3 June 2007, the Observer reported that he had donated £1 million to the Labour Party (one of the most generous ever donations to Labour, eclipsed only by a £2m donation from the steel billionaire [[Lakshmi Mittal]], and a similar sum given by [[David Sainsbury, Baron Sainsbury of Turville|Lord Sainsbury]]).
==References== {{Reflist}} * [http://observer.guardian.co.uk/politics/story/0,,2094318,00.html Observer] * [http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/about-us/what-we-do/protocol/honours/honorary-awards Foreign & Commonwealth Office] * [http://iranica.com/pages/iranica-news-page1]
==External links== * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070607212646/http://www.thekhayamifoundation.org/ The Khayami Foundation] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20110901234226/http://www.ikco.com/ Iran Khodro Web Site] * [http://www.persianvillage.com/gala/nlstory.cfm?ID=73&NLID=393/ Encyclopædia Iranica Gala 2003] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20060829073940/http://www.ikco.com/default.aspx Iran Khodro Web Site] * [http://www.calibermotors.com/ Caliber Motors, Anaheim, California] * [http://www.papalknights.org.uk/ Association of Papal Orders in Great Britain] * [https://web.archive.org/web/20070404045513/http://www.chathamhouse.org.uk/index.php?id=190 Royal Institute for International Affairs]
{{Authority control}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Khayami, Mahmoud}} [[Category:Iranian businesspeople]] [[Category:Exiles of the Iranian Revolution in France]] [[Category:Knights of St. Sylvester]] [[Category:Knights Grand Cross of the Royal Order of Francis I]] [[Category:Commanders of the Order of the British Empire]] [[Category:People from Mashhad]] [[Category:1930 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Iranian emigrants to France]] [[Category:Iranian emigrants to the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Exiles of the Iranian Revolution in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Labour Party (UK) donors]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2015}} '''Massimo Cellino''' ({{IPA-it|ˈmasːimo tʃelː'iːno}}; born 28 July 1956) is an Italian entrepreneur and [[Association football|football]] club owner. Through his family trust Eleonora Sport Ltd he was the owner and chairman of the English club [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].<ref name=YEPApr11>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-exclusive-massimo-cellino-interview-1-6554928|title=Leeds United exclusive: Massimo Cellino interview|author=Phil Hay|date=11 April 2014 |work=Yorkshire Evening Post|accessdate=12 April 2014}}</ref> He currently owns [[Brescia Calcio]].<ref>http://www.football-italia.net/107947/official-cellino-buys-brescia</ref>
==Career==
===Cagliari Calcio=== Cellino was the chairman of the Italian association football club [[Cagliari Calcio]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Fulvio |last=Bianchi |title=Sempre più Italia in Premier Cellino compra il West Ham |url=http://www.repubblica.it/sport/calcio/2010/01/13/news/cellino_al_west_ham-1935955/ |work=La Repubblica |date=13 January 2010 |accessdate=23 January 2010 |quote=Cellino è presidente dal 1992 del Cagliari, club che rilevò dai fratelli Orrù. |language=Italian}}</ref> He has served as vice-president for [[Serie A]] in the [[Lega Nazionale Professionisti|Lega Calcio]].
During his years as owner of Cagliari Calcio, Cellino was instrumental in the building of their sports centre in [[Assemini]], near Cagliari, named after his father Ercole.<ref>{{cite news |first=Matt |last=Hughes |title=Man who lured Gianfranco Zola back home is latest bidder for West Ham |url=http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/sport/football/premier_league/west_ham/article6987216.ece |work=The Times |date=14 January 2010 |accessdate=23 January 2010 |quote=Cellino has proved himself to be a popular and successful owner at Cagliari, providing the finance for the club’s new training ground and sports complex in Assemini .... | location=London}}</ref>
[[Luis Diego López|Diego López]] was sacked by Cellino as Cagliari manager on 6 April 2014, this being the 36th manager change he went through in 22 years of his tenure at Cagliari Calcio. Cellino earned the nickname ''Il mangia-allenatori'', "The Manager Eater".<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2598466/Massimo-Cellino-sacks-Diego-Lopez-Cagliari-coach-just-hours-sealing-Leeds-takeover.html|title=Cellino sacks Lopez as Cagliari coach just hours after sealing Leeds takeover|publisher=[[Daily Mail]]|date=7 April 2014|accessdate=3 June 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29787237|title=The sack race: Are chairmen running out of patience?|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 October 2014|accessdate=27 October 2014}}</ref>
Cellino intended to sell Cagliari Calcio, and has said that an agreed sale failed due to the wish of the prospective buyers for him to stay and run the club. He finally sold the club to the Italian entrepreneur Tommaso Giulini on June 2014 after 22 years of ownership.<ref name="YEPApr11"/>
===Leeds United=== In January 2014, speculation grew that Leeds would be subject to takeover by Cellino. A delegation representing Cellino was seen at [[Elland Road]], Leeds' stadium, and the [[Thorp Arch (training ground)|Thorp Arch]] training ground several times, and on 28 January it was reported that Cellino had asked for his associate and former Middlesbrough defender [[Gianluca Festa]] to sit in the dugout for Leeds' 1–1 draw with Ipswich.<ref name="Sky News">{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/9143857/consortium-looks-to-re-open-leeds-takeover-talks-as-cellino-closes-on-deal|title=Consortium looks to re-open Leeds takeover talks as Cellino closes on deal |publisher=Sky News|date= |accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref> Cellino had previously tried to buy [[West Ham United]] in 2010.<ref name=YEPApr11/>
On 31 January it was reported that [[Brian McDermott (footballer)|Brian McDermott]] had been sacked as manager of the club, with Gianluca Festa speculated in the media as his most likely replacement.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/football/news/brian-mcdermott-sacked-leeds-ditch-3099605#.UuwZBPl_tXE|title=Brian McDermott sacked by Leeds as Massimo Cellino finalises takeover of the club |publisher=The Mirror|date= |accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref> The following day reports emerged suggesting [[Gulf Finance House]] (GFH) club directors were attempting to reinstate McDermott as manager, saying the Cellino family (the club's prospective new owners) had no authority to dismiss him.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/leeds-confirm-agreement-over-sale-as-stunning-twist-sees-club-try-and-persuade-brian-mcdermott-to-return-as-manager-9101175.html|title=Leeds turmoil continues as directors inform Brian McDermott that new owners-in-waiting had no authority to sack him|publisher=Independent|date= |accessdate=1 February 2014}}</ref> On 1 February, McDermott's Elland Road assistant Nigel Gibbs was named as caretaker manager for the club's home derby against Huddersfield Town.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/cellino-flexes-his-muscles-at-leeds-united-1-6412039|title=Cellino flexes his muscles at Leeds United |publisher=Yorkshire Eve Post|date= |accessdate=1 February 2014}}</ref> Following the game, the club released an official statement stating McDermott had not been dismissed and remained first team manager.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/dq604pw575cz1c7zdt070sugw/title/brian-mcdermott-club-statement |title=Brian McDermott: Club Statement |publisher=Leeds United official website |date=1 February 2014 |accessdate=1 February 2014}}</ref>
After weeks of speculation the club announced, on 7 February 2014, that they had exchanged contracts with Cellino's family consortium Eleonora Sport Ltd. The deal would see the Cellino family acquire 75% ownership of the club, subject to approval from the Football League.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/16cr3klmb3cpp1xljskfrgkd8q/title/statements-from-our-owners|title=STATEMENTS FROM OUR OWNERS |publisher=Leeds United|date=7 February 2014 |accessdate=7 February 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26084726|title=SLeeds United exchange contracts on Massimo Cellino takeover |publisher=BBC Sport|date=7 February 2014 |accessdate=7 February 2014}}</ref> The Football League rejected the proposal on 24 March 2014, stating that Cellino failed the owner's test.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.football-league.co.uk/footballleaguenews/20140324/football-league-statement-massimo-cellino_2293334_3729469|title=Latest Football League News|publisher=|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140328091305/http://www.football-league.co.uk/footballleaguenews/20140324/football-league-statement-massimo-cellino_2293334_3729469|archivedate=28 March 2014|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Cellino exercised his right to appeal the Football Leagues's decision. His appeal was heard on 31 March 2014 by an independent QC and, on 5 April 2014, the decision was overturned as Cellino's recent conviction did not involve conduct that would 'reasonably be considered to be dishonest' based on information available to him at the time.<ref>http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/9250458/sky-bet-championship-massimo-cellino-wins-appeal-against-football-league</ref> GFH retained a 10 per cent stake in the club, with minority shareholders holding 25 per cent.<ref name=YEPApr11/>
Cellino later said that had he known that the takeover would not proceed smoothly he would not have bought the club and described the Football League as "...really tricky, they made trouble at a time when I couldn't walk away and I submitted myself to a trial, a humiliation...I don't want to be here if the Football League don’t want me but who are they anyway?...They are acting for what's right, the principles, the ideals. Me, I sort out the f*cking problems at Leeds. I prefer to play by the rules, not to cheat."<ref name=YEPApr11/> Cellino has been disparaging of GFH's management of Leeds, saying that "...You can see what’s been happening here – it's been done by people who knew they weren't staying. And now I have to clean up the sh*t...GFH made big mistakes but not on purpose. That's why I don’t go against them for the moment. But the men who were here in GFH's name did a really, really bad job. That's not GFH fault. They trust people they shouldn't."<ref name=YEPApr11/> Cellino described the fans of Leeds as "...tired of eating sh*t and shutting their mouths. They accept me with enthusiasm and that gives me a lot of responsibility. I'm the richest man in the world with these fans and I can challenge anyone, everyone."<ref name=YEPApr11/>
Cellino later questioned manager Brian McDermott's decision to take a holiday, proclaiming that Leeds "have no manager", and asked "Who's managing this club?' Brian, where's Brian?".<ref>{{Cite web|title=New Leeds owner Massimo Cellino says United has no manager|url=http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2014-05-14/exclusive-interview-new-leeds-owner-massimo-cellino-says-united-has-no-manager/|work=ITV |date=14 May 2014}}</ref> It was also revealed that the retain and release list of players would be handled by Cellino and [[Benito Carbone]] and not McDermott.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Carbone’s role with Leeds United confirmed|url=http://www.morleyobserver.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/carbone-s-role-with-leeds-united-confirmed-1-6619156 |work=Morley Observer|date=1 May 2014}}</ref> Leeds later confirmed Carbone's position at the club in a statement, confirming that he would 'be involved with all football matters, including both the first team and the academy'.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/196b1zxifhka91avx90ksm5wk8/title/statement-benito-carbone|title=STATEMENT: BENITO CARBONE. Carbone to join staff at Elland Road|publisher=Leeds United Official Website|date=15 May 2014 |accessdate=15 May 2014}}</ref>
On 30 May, Leeds reached a mutual agreement with manager Brian McDermott to end his spell at the club. With Cellino wanting to hire a head coach rather than a manager.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27646829|title=Brian McDermott leaves Leeds United by mutual consent|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 May 2014 |accessdate=30 May 2014}}</ref> On 16 June, McDermott was succeeded as Leeds manager by [[Dave Hockaday]] who took up the role in a head coach capacity.<ref>{{cite web|title=David Hockaday named as new head coach…|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/1hylw6lsjl1yn14n6t68sfo7nc/title/united-appoint-new-head-coach|publisher=Leeds United A.F.C|accessdate=19 June 2014}}</ref> On 11 July 2014, Leeds under-18s manager [[Richard Naylor]] was made redundant as was Leeds under-16s coach [[Leigh Bromby]]. On 3 August 2014, after joining the club in April 2014 sporting consultant Benito Carbone left his job after his relationship with Cellino deteriorated.<ref name="Leeds United: Carbone leaves Whites">{{cite web |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds-united-carbone-leaves-whites-1-6765142|title=Leeds United: Carbone leaves Whites|publisher=Yorkshire Evening Post|date=3 August 2014 |first=|last=|accessdate=3 August 2014}}</ref><ref name="twitter.com">{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/LUFC/status/505055655783583744|title=Leeds United FC on Twitter|work=Twitter}}</ref>
After a 4–1 defeat to [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on 23 August,<ref>{{cite news|title=TWO OFF IN WATFORD DEFEAT|date=23 August 2014|accessdate=23 August 2014|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/sojpa30okel317a4kki4xhnbg/title/two-off-in-watford-defeat|publisher=Leeds United official site|author=}}</ref> Cellino had made up his mind to sack head coach Hockaday; however he had a change of heart, deciding to blame himself for the club's poor start to the season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds: Massimo Cellino changed mind over sacking Dave Hockaday|date=24 August 2014|accessdate=24 August 2014|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28915869|publisher=BBC Sport|author=}}</ref> Five days later, he changed his mind again and sacked Hockaday.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/9444953/championship-leeds-sack-head-coach-david-hockaday-just-six-games-into-new-season|title=Championship: Leeds sack head coach David Hockaday just six games into new season|work=SkySports}}</ref> Assistant [[Junior Lewis]] was sacked at the same time, with the duo having been at the club for only 70 days.<ref name="twitter.com"/><ref name="CLUB STATEMENT: DAVID HOCKADAY">{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/czqaoeenck6d1qxe2tf34eerc/title/club-statement-david-hockaday|title=CLUB STATEMENT: DAVID HOCKADAY|publisher=Leeds United|date=27 August 2014 |first=|last=|accessdate=27 August 2014}}</ref>
Cellino aimed to repurchase Leeds' [[Elland Road]] stadium in 2014, and expects the club to be in the [[Premier League]], the top tier of English football, by the end of the 2015–16 season.<ref name=YEPApr11/> In September 2014, Cellino appointed [[Darko Milanič]] as the new head coach of Leeds on a two-year deal replacing Hockaday,<ref>{{Cite news | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/l9x1e0mkjtui12nhj4m267y8n/title/united-confirm-darko-milanic | title = UNITED CONFIRM DARKO MILANIC| publisher = Leeds United Official Website | date = 23 September 2014 | accessdate = 23 September 2014 }}</ref> though Milanič was dismissed 32 days later after not winning one of his six games while in charge.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29774801|title=Darko Milanic: Leeds United part company with head coach|publisher=BBC Sport|date=25 October 2014|accessdate=25 October 2014 }}</ref> In November 2014 [[Neil Redfearn]] was confirmed as the new head coach of Leeds, on an initial 12-month contract with the option of a further 12 months, the contract also had a clause that would see Redfearn return to the academy if he was to leave his role as head coach.
On 1 December 2014, Cellino was disqualified by the [[Football League]] and asked to resign from the club. The Football League took the decision after obtaining documents from an Italian court, where he was found guilty of tax evasion.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30276764|title=Leeds owner Massimo Cellino disqualified by Football League|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 December 2014}}</ref> On 19 January 2015, Cellino's appeal against the Football League's disqualification was rejected, with the appeal committee ruling that his ban would stand.
However, Cellino, and the club, were facing another charge which related to the length of time it took Cellino to present [[The Football League]] with the court documents in the first place. This was settled in March 2015, and resulted in Cellino having his ban extended until 8 May 2015, the day after the 2014–15 season ended, to which Cellino responded by saying that he would return to his president role at the club once the ban expired.
On the 2nd April, During Cellino's ban away from the club, Cellino's sporting director [[Nicola Salerno (sporting executive)|Nicola Salerno]] mysteriously suspended [[Steve Thompson (footballer, born 1964)|Steve Thompson]], Leeds assistant manager who was credited with lifting Leeds from a place above relegation to 10th in the Football Championship. Leeds had won 6 out of the previous 10 matches. On 9 April 2015, Leeds United's suspended owner, Cellino, informed the press that he believed Salerno had resigned.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/2091921https://www.theguardian.com/football/2015/apr/02/leeds-assistant-manager-steve-thompson |title=Leeds United suspend assistant manager Steve Thompson |date=2 April 2015 |work=The Guardian |publisher=The Guardian |accessdate=2 April 2015 }}</ref>
Cellino, with the approval of the Football League returned to the club, rejoining the board as club chairman and president on 2 May 2015.{{Citation needed|date=October 2016}}
On 14 May 2015, Cellino carried out a press conference unveiling [[Adam Pearson]] as the club's Executive Director to work directly alongside Cellino. The press conference included Cellino leaving halfway through for a cigarette break only to return, and for the press conference to run for over an hour, with Cellino refusing to reveal the future of Head Coach Neil Redfearn. Cellino revealed that he would also sell the club if he felt he was not ready to take the club to the premier league by 2016/17 season.<ref>{{cite news|title= Leeds United: Redfearn future unclear after Cellino press conference |date=14 May 2015|accessdate=|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/video-leeds-united-redfearn-future-unclear-after-cellino-press-conference-1-7261051|publisher=Yorkshire Evening Post|author=Leon Wobschall}}</ref>
However, on 16 May, with speculation mounting further about Neil Redfearn's future as Leeds United Head Coach, Cellino in an interview with The Mirror proclaimed Redfearn to be 'weak' and 'a baby'.<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds owner Massimo Cellino says manager Neil Redfearn is 'weak' and 'a baby' |date=16 May 2015|accessdate=|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/9853957/leeds-owner-massimo-cellino-says-manager-neil-redfearn-is-weak-and-a-baby|publisher=Sky Sports News|author=Sky Sports}}</ref>
On 20 May 2015, [[Uwe Rösler]] was appointed as the Head Coach of Championship side [[Leeds United]] on a two-year deal.<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/6lode4gb1vvd140hwkb9ls7dm/title/uwe-rosler-named-head-coach | title = UWE ROSLER NAMED HEAD COACH | website = Leeds United | date = 20 May 2015 | accessdate = 20 May 2015}}</ref>
On 24 June 2015, it was announced that after Cellino's long time friend [[Nicola Salerno (sporting executive)|Nicola Salerno]] had helped the club sign [[Sol Bamba]] from [[U.S. Città di Palermo|Palermo]]<ref>{{cite web|title=SOL BAMBA SIGNS PERMANENT DEAL|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/1j2rtmixcjnu4zb363s7ebb4q/title/sol-bamba-signs-permanent-deal|publisher=Leeds United|date=24 June 2015|accessdate= 24 June 2015}}</ref> that Salerno and the club had agreed a mutual termination of Salerno's contract, with the club stating ''Leeds United would like to thank Nicola for his efforts over the past year and he will always be welcomed back to Elland Road in the future''.<ref>{{cite web|title=AGREEMENT REACHED WITH SALERNO|url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/hl7tr54rrnhh16k3kcs3maf50/title/agreement-reached-with-salerno|publisher=Leeds United|date=24 June 2015|accessdate= 24 June 2015}}</ref>
On 22 September 2015, Cellino criticized Leeds player [[Sam Byram]], Cellino revealed he was 'deeply offended' and 'hurt' that Byram had not signed a new contract at Leeds United.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports | date= 22 September 2015 | accessdate= 22 September 2015 | title= Sam Byram 'refused' new deal, says 'hurt' Cellino | url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11715/10001590/sam-bryam-thinks-he-is-too-big-for-leeds-and-will-not-sign-new-contract-says-massimo-cellino}}</ref> Yorkshire Evening Post reported that the contract offer from Cellino to Byram was actually a reduction on his existing wage.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Yorkshire Evening Post | date= 22 September 2015 | accessdate= 22 September 2015 | title= Byram too big for his boots, blasts Leeds United chief Cellino| url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-utd/byram-too-big-for-his-boots-blasts-leeds-united-chief-cellino-1-7475166}}</ref>
On 16 October, Cellino advised as a protest to The Football League, about kick off changes for televised games that he would limit Leeds away fan ticket allocated to the bare minimum football league requirement of 2k.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 16 October 2015 | accessdate= 16 October 2015 | title= Massimo Cellino: Leeds will limit tickets for away matches| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34557043}}</ref> The decision was met with anger from Leeds United fans, who advised the reduced allocation was not the way forward for the clubs fans. On 20 October, Cellino performed a u-turn on his decision to limit Leeds fans ticket allocation at away games, after heavy criticism from the clubs fans.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Yorkshire Evening Post | date= 20 October 2015 | accessdate= 20 October 2015 | title= Leeds United perform U-turn over away tickets after meeting with fans| url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-lufc-news/leeds-united-perform-u-turn-over-away-tickets-after-meeting-with-fans-1-7526616}}</ref>
On 19 October, [[Uwe Rösler]] was sacked after two wins from just 12 games in charge, following a 2–1 home defeat to [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] which left Leeds in 18th place in the Championship.<ref>{{cite web |title=Uwe Rosler: Leeds United sack head coach after 12 games|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34570202|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=19 October 2015|date=19 October 2015}}</ref> On the same day, he was replaced him as Leeds Head Coach with former Rotherham Manager [[Steve Evans (footballer, born 1962)|Steve Evans]].<ref>{{Cite news | title = Steve Evans Appointed United Head Coach | url = http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/lm93yhyyeu4216fh9qrmospzg/title/steve-evans-appointed-united-head-coach | publisher = Leeds United F.C. | date = 19 October 2015}}</ref>
Also on the 19 October, it was announced by the Football League that Cellino had been disqualified as Leeds United owner for a year, the second time he has been banned by the football League, for an issue regarding Italian Tax Legislation thus failing the Football League's Owners & Directors Test.<ref>{{Cite news | title = Steve Evans: Leeds appoint new boss as Massimo Cellino banned | url = https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34570202 | publisher = BBC Sport | date = 19 October 2015}}</ref>
On 30 October, Cellino revealed he would sell Leeds United to Leeds United Fans Group 'Leeds Fans United', announcing "100% I will sell to the fans, if they want to buy it and look after the club. The fans are the only asset the club has."<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 30 October 2015 | accessdate= 30 October 2015 | title= Massimo Cellino: Leeds chairman agrees to sell club to fans| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34676783}}</ref>
On 2 November, Cellino revealed that he would no longer attend Leeds United matches due to vocal criticism after he attended the clubs 2-0 loss against [[Blackburn Rovers]].<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports | date= 2 November 2015 | accessdate= 2 November 2015 | title= Leeds United owner Massimo Cellino: I will not attend matches| url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11715/10053563/leeds-united-owner-massimo-cellino-i-will-not-attend-matches}}</ref>
On 4 November, Cellino announced a dramatic u-turn of his decision to sell the club to Leeds Fans United, and accused the potential buyers of 'fairytales'. With LFU announcing a statement "Leeds Fans Utd has just been informed by the lawyers of Massimo Cellino that he no longer wishes to sell to Leeds fans."<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports | date= 4 November 2015 | accessdate= 4 November 2015 | title= Massimo Cellino fed up of 'fairytales' and ready to sell Leeds| url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11715/10055337/massimo-cellino-fed-up-of-fairytales-and-ready-to-sell-leeds}}</ref>
On 13 November, The Football League announced that Cellino's disqualification ban had been deferred due to Cellino appealing the ban, they announced that should Cellino's appeal fail after the hearing, that the deferral would not change the length of the ban.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 13 November 2015 | accessdate= 13 November 2015 | title= Massimo Cellino: Leeds United chairman's ban deferred| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34811369}}</ref>
On 29 December, Cellino banned Sky Sports cameras from entering Elland Road to live broadcast Leeds' game against Derby. However, due to possible sanctions the club could face, the broadcasting team were 'reluctantly' allowed in.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 29 December 2015 | accessdate= 30 December 2015 | title= Leeds United will be charged with misconduct if they ban Sky TV| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35191715}}</ref>
With speculation if Evans would be retained as head coach for the 2016–17 season, on 18 April 2016, Cellino's interview with the ''Daily Telegraph'' cast doubt of head coach [[Steve Evans (footballer, born 1962)|Steve Evans]] long term prospects, Cellino advised he felt Evans 'talks too much' and that Evans had to learn to 'shut his mouth'.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= Sky Sports | date= 18 April 2016 | accessdate= 18 April 2016 | title= Steve Evans future at Leeds United in doubt after fresh outburst from Massimo Cellino| url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/steve-evans-future-at-leeds-united-in-doubt-after-fresh-outburst-from-massimo-cellino-1-7858820}}</ref>
On 9 May 2016, Cellino was acquitted 'on appeal' for his tax evasion conviction, after failing to pay VAT on a Range Rover imported from the USA into Italy.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 9 May 2016 | accessdate= 9 May 2016 | title= Massimo Cellino: Leeds United owner acquitted of tax evasion charge| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36247708}}</ref>
Despite being acquitted of tax evasion and the resulting removal of the Football League disqualification, on 13 May 2016, Cellino revealed in an exclusive interview with ''The Times'' that he had regretted buying the club, and that he would now sell the club if he received the right offer.<ref>{{cite news|publisher= BBC Sport | date= 13 May 2016 | accessdate= 13 May 2016 | title= Massimo Cellino: Leeds United owner reveals regret at buying Championship club| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36285825}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|publisher= The Times | date= 13 May 2016 | accessdate= 13 May 2016 | title= I’m ready to sell Leeds, says frightened Cellino| url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/edition/sport/i-am-ready-to-sell-leeds-says-frightened-cellino-fcpdstz08}}</ref>
On 23 May 2016, it was revealed that [[MK Dons]] manager [[Karl Robinson]] had turned down the opportunity from Cellino to become Leeds United head coach, further casting doubt on current head coach [[Steve Evans (footballer, born 1962)|Steve Evans]]' future at the club.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=BBC Sport| date= 23 May 2016 | accessdate= 23 May 2016 | title= Karl Robinson: MK Dons boss turns down Leeds United managerial offer| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36364264}}</ref> On 27 May, after being turned down by Robinson, Cellino then approached [[Bristol Rovers]] manager [[Darrell Clarke]] to replace Evans, however he was again rebuffed with Clarke preferring to sign a new deal at Bristol.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=Yorkshire Evening Post| date= 27 May 2016 | accessdate= 27 May 2016 | title= Leeds United rebuffed as Darrell Clarke signs lucrative new deal with Bristol Rovers| url=http://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/sport/football/leeds-united/leeds-united-rebuffed-as-darrell-clarke-signs-lucrative-new-deal-with-bristol-rovers-1-7935107}}</ref>
On 31 May 2016, Steve Evans and his assistant [[Paul Raynor]] were both sacked by Cellino, becoming the sixth manager to be sacked by Cellino in two years. On Evans' sacking Cellino revealed in a club statement that he felt the club 'needed a different approach in order to achieve targets for the new season'.<ref>{{cite news|publisher=Leeds United Official Site| date= 31 May 2016 | accessdate= 31 May 2016 | title= CLUB STATEMENT: STEVE EVANS: United part company with head coach.| url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/v5xndospy3p51p6dj2huhq0wo/title/club-statement-steve-evans}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|publisher=BBC Sport| date= 31 May 2016 | accessdate= 31 May 2016 | title= Steve Evans: Leeds United sack head coach| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36420398}}</ref>
In June 2016, ex-[[Leeds United]]-women's forward and former Education & Welfare officer [[Lucy Ward (footballer)|Lucy Ward]] won a high-profile legal battle against her dismissal from the club in 2015.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3635156/Leeds-owner-Massimo-Cellino-does-U-turn-giving-evidence-case-against-Lucy-Ward-press-attention-concerns.html|title=Lucy Ward case could cost Leeds United more than £500,000 as owner Massimo Cellino performs U-turn in giving evidence due to 'press attention' concerns|author=Jack Gaughan|publisher=Daily Mail|date=10 June 2016|accessdate=10 June 2016 }}</ref>
On 2 June 2016, [[Garry Monk]] was appointed the new head coach of Leeds United on a one-year rolling contract, replacing Evans.<ref>{{cite news|title=Garry Monk: Leeds United appoint former Swansea City boss|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36433909|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=2 June 2016|date=2 June 2016}}</ref>
On 8 September 2016, Cellino's Eleonora Sport Ltd became Leeds United's 100% share owners, after buying the 15% shares of minority owner [[Gulf Finance House]] (GFH Capital), thus becoming Leeds United's sole majority shareholder.
On 4 January 2017, [[Andrea Radrizzani]] purchased a 50 percent stake from Cellino for [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Leeds United: Owner Massimo Cellino sells 50% stake to Italian businessman|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38511004|accessdate=4 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 January 2017}}</ref>
On 23 May 2017, [[Andrea Radrizzani]] announced the 100% buyout of [[Leeds United]], buying the remaining 50% shares from previous co-owner Massimo Cellino, with Radrizzani taking full ownership of the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.leedsunited.com/news/club-news/21921/club-statement|title=CLUB STATEMENT|publisher=Leeds United F.C. |date=23 May 2017|accessdate=23 May 2017}}</ref> Cellino issued a statement on the club website thanking the fans and said 'if you can survive working with me, you can survive anything'.
===Brescia=== After leaving Leeds, Cellino returned to Italy and purchased [[Serie B]] Side Brescia. On 3 June 2017, Manager [[Roberto Boscaglia]] was appointed by Brescia as their head coach for the [[2017–18 Serie B]] season.<ref name="boscaglia_brescia">{{cite news |url=http://www.bresciacalcio.it/stagione/news/5415-bentornato-mister.html |publisher=Brescia Calcio |language=Italian |title=Bentornato Mister! |accessdate=4 June 2017 |date=3 June 2017}}</ref> However, Cellino replaced him with [[Pasquale Marino]] on 12 October 2017, only a few weeks after the club's takeover by Cellino.<ref name="marino_brescia">{{cite news |url=http://www.bresciacalcio.it/stagione/news/5568-pasquale-marino-e-il-nuovo-allenatore-delle-rondinelle.html | publisher=Brescia Calcio |language=Italian |accessdate=15 October 2017 |date=12 October 2017 |title=Pasquale Marino è il nuovo allenatore delle rondinelle }}</ref> On 16 January 2018, Cellino then re-hired [[Roberto Boscaglia]] as Head Coach, following Marino's firing.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=Brescia Calcio|language=Italian|url=https://www.bresciacalcio.it/news/ultime-news/11573/roberto-boscaglia-nuovo-allenatore-del-brescia|title=Roberto Boscaglia nuovo allenatore del Brescia|date=16 January 2018}}</ref> He was however sacked once again on 29 April, leaving Brescia in thirteenth place in the Serie B table.<ref name="pulga_brescia">{{cite news |url=https://sport.sky.it/calcio/serie-b/2018/04/29/brescia-esonerato-boscaglia-pulga-nuovo-allenatore.html |publisher=SKY Sport Italia |language=Italian |title=Brescia, esonerato Boscaglia: Pulga nuovo allenatore |date=29 April 2018 |accessdate=30 April 2018}}</ref> On 29 April 2018, Cellino appointed his 4th Manager of the 2017/18 season<ref name="pulga_brescia">{{cite news |url=https://sport.sky.it/calcio/serie-b/2018/04/29/brescia-esonerato-boscaglia-pulga-nuovo-allenatore.html |publisher=SKY Sport Italia |language=Italian |title=Brescia, esonerato Boscaglia: Pulga nuovo allenatore |date=29 April 2018 |accessdate=30 April 2018}}</ref>, by appointing [[Ivo Pulga]] as the new Head Coach after the dismissal of [[Roberto Boscaglia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://translate.google.co.uk/translate?hl=en&sl=it&u=https://www.bresciacalcio.it/&prev=search|title=Official Press: Ivo Pulga new coach|publisher=Brescia |date=29 April 2018|accessdate=29 April 2018}}</ref>
==Convictions and arrests== Cellino was arrested in February 2013 with the mayor of Quartu Sant'Elena, Mauro Contini, and the public works commissioner Stefano Lilliu, for attempted embezzlement and fraudulent misrepresentation following an investigation into the construction of the [[Stadio Is Arenas]].<ref name=IndFeb4>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/who-is-massimo-cellino-the-controversial-italian-vying-to-take-over-leeds-united-9107541.html|title=Who is Massimo Cellino? The controversial Italian vying to take over Leeds United|author=Dylan Fahy|date=4 February 2014 |work=The Independent |accessdate=4 February 2014}}</ref> Cellino was held in custody for over two weeks, in a case which remains unresolved. Cellino's arrest warrant called him a man of "marked criminal tendencies ... capable of using every kind of deception to achieve his ends".<ref name=IndFeb4/> Cellino has two prior criminal convictions, for deceiving the Italian Ministry of Agriculture out of £7.5m in 1996 and for false accounting at Cagliari in 2001.<ref name=IndFeb4/>
==Personal life== Cellino has a deep suspicion of the number 17, which is considered unlucky in [[17 (number)|Italian culture]].{{citation needed|date=August 2014}} At Cagliari's stadium Cellino had the number 17 removed from seats and replaced with 16b.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11715/9155007/leeds-united-confirm-sale-of-75-per-cent-to-massimo-cellino|title=Leeds United confirm sale of 75 per cent to Massimo Cellino |publisher=Sky Sports|date=7 February 2014 |accessdate=7 February 2014}}</ref> Cellino also has a dislike for the colour purple, which is also considered unlucky in Italy, see [http://www.lifeinitaly.com/potpourri/italiansuperstitions.asp Italian superstitions].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/phil-hay-leeds-united-looking-for-purple-patch-on-field-but-maybe-not-off-it-1-6411105|title=Leeds United looking for purple patch on field – but maybe not off it |publisher=Sky Sports|date=31 January 2014 |accessdate=31 January 2014}}</ref> On 15 May 2014, Leeds United retired the number 17 shirt due to superstitious reasons for Cellino. Up until June 2014, the last occupant of the shirt had been [[Michael Brown (footballer, born 1977)|Michael Brown]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.itv.com/news/calendar/2014-05-15/not-for-tv-cellinos-best-bits/ |title=Massimo Cellino says Leeds "has no manager" |work=ITV |date=15 May 2014 |accessdate=15 May 2014}}</ref>
He plays guitar in the cover band Maurillos.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/football-league/who-is-massimo-cellino-the-controversial-italian-vying-to-take-over-leeds-united-9107541.html|title=Who is Massimo Cellino? The controversial Italian vying to take over Leeds United |publisher=Independent|date=4 February 2014 |accessdate=11 February 2014}}</ref> On 3 May 2014, at Leeds United's annual end of season awards, Cellino joined the band [[The Pigeon Detectives]] on lead guitar for a cover version of [[Jimi Hendrix]]'s song "[[Hey Joe]]".<ref name="Massimo Cellino jams with the Pigeon Detectives at Leeds' end of season party">{{Cite news | title = Massimo Cellino jams with the Pigeon Detectives at Leeds' end of season party | url = http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2619862/Massimo-Cellino-jams-Pigeon-Detectives-Leeds-end-season-party.html | publisher = Daily Mail | date = 3 May 2014 | accessdate = 3 May 2014}}</ref>
Cellino has properties in [[Leeds]] and [[Miami]], Florida.<ref name=YEPApr11/><ref>{{cite news |first=Simon |last=Cass |title=Race hots up to buy West Ham with Cagliari president Massimo Cellino and InterMarket consortium locked in two-horse £100m takeover race |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1243127/Gianfranco-Zolas-chief-new-favourite-stun-David-Gold-David-Sullivan-West-Ham.html |work=Daily Mail |accessdate=23 January 2010 |quote=Cellino, who lives in Miami, .... | location=London | date=15 January 2010}}.</ref> Cellino has a wife, Frances, and three children: two sons, [[Ercole Cellino|Ercole]] and Edoardo who were directors at Leeds United, and a daughter Eleonora.

{{Orphan|date=February 2013}} '''Papiloa Foliaki''' is a [[Tonga]]n former politician. She initially worked as a nurse, headed a nurses' union, and "led Tonga's first ever [[strike action|strike]]". She then went into business, as owner and operator of the Friendly Islander Hotel. In 1978, she was elected as a People's Representative to the [[Legislative Assembly of Tonga]] – the second woman ever (and first [[commoner]] woman) to sit in the Tongan Parliament, after Princess Si'uilikutapu (1975–78). Foliaki served until 1981.[https://books.google.com/books?id=ZUpmpeJz-8gC&pg=PA205 ''New politics in the South Pacific'', 1994, p.204] ==References== {{reflist}}

revision.text:
'''Percy Nilsson''' (born 22 May 1943 in [[Malmö]]) is a Swedish businessman, constructor and sports person. He is most notable for his long-term chairmanship of [[Malmö Redhawks]] and the construction of [[Malmö Arena]] by his company Parkfast AB.
==Career== Percy Nilsson is an educated [[carpenter]], Nilsson has also been a [[nightclub]] owner.<ref name="Fokus" /> He soon started his own construction company, Percy Nilsson Bygg (PNB). PNB was sold by Nilsson in 2004, although he had sold the company previously in the 1990s and later bought back a 50% stock share. PNB went bankrupt shortly after the sale and Nilsson was held accountable by his guaranty, Nilsson paid 112 million [[Swedish krona|kronor]] to various creditors.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sydsvenskan.se/ekonomi/byggjatten-pnb-i-konkurs/ | title=Byggjätten PNB i konkurs | publisher=Sydsvenskan | work=www.sydsvenskan.se | date=31 December 2011 | accessdate=15 July 2012}}</ref>
===Malmö Redhawks=== Percy Nilsson was elected chairman of [[ice hockey]] club [[Malmö Redhawks]] in 1984. Percy Nilsson contributed large funds to the club to turn around its bad financial situation. The bid turned out to be successful as Redhawks was promoted to the highest tier of Swedish ice hockey, [[Swedish Hockey League|Elitserien]] in 1990. The club also became [[List of Swedish ice hockey champions|Swedish champions]] in 1992 and 1994. The club was relegated to [[HockeyAllsvenskan]] again in 2005 but returned to the highest tier in 2006 when it was relegated after one season.
Nilsson resigned as chairman of Redhawks in 2005 as he had been sentenced to a one-year prison sentence for dubious disbursements on 27 April 2005.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=101&artikel=603651 | title=Ett års fängelse för Percy Nilsson | publisher=Sveriges Radio | work=sverigesradio.se | date=27 April 2005 | accessdate=15 July 2012}}</ref> Nilsson was later fully acquitted on 1 March 2006 after the case had been appealed to [[Hovrätt]]en.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sydsvenskan.se/sport/percy-nilsson-friades-i-hovratten/ | title=Percy Nilsson friades i hovrätten | publisher=Sydsvenskan | work=www.sydsvenskan.se | date=4 March 2006 | accessdate=15 July 2012}}</ref> Nilsson returned to the chairman post in 2007 but later resigned again in 2008 after the club had failed to be promoted to Elitserien.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.sydsvenskan.se/sport/ishockey/redhawks/percy-nilsson-avgar/ | title=Percy Nilsson avgår | publisher=Sydsvenskan | work=www.sydsvenskan.se | date=15 August 2008 | accessdate=15 July 2012}}</ref>
===Malmö Arena=== Percy Nilsson bought land at [[Hyllievång]] in [[Malmö]] from [[Malmö Municipality|Malmö Stad]] for 250 million [[Swedish krona|kronor]] in 2007. A couple of days later Nilsson sold the majority of the land to retail concern [[Steen & Strom ASA|Steen & Strøm]] for as much as 570 million kronor. The profit was used by Nilsson to fund the construction of [[Malmö Arena]].<ref name="Fokus">{{cite web | url=http://www.fokus.se/2009/03/percy-nilsson-byggherre-och-vaktmastare/ | title=Percy Nilsson, byggherre och vaktmästare | publisher=Fokus | work=fokus.se | date=13 March 2009 | accessdate=15 July 2012}}</ref>
==References== {{Reflist|2}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nilsson, Percy}} [[Category:Swedish businesspeople]] [[Category:People from Malmö]] [[Category:Swedish sports businesspeople]] [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Businesspeople in construction]]

'''Raam Jethmal Punjabi''' ([[Punjabi language|Punjabi]]: ਰਾਮ ਪੰਜਾਬੀ) is an [[Indian Indonesian]] media magnate and president of [[Cinema of Indonesia#1990s|Multivision Plus]].<ref name="asiaimage1"/> In 2001, due to his production of [[soap opera]]s, he was referred to as "Indonesia's own soap king".<ref name="dailynews1"/>
==Early life== He was born in [[Surabaya]], [[East Java]] to parents of [[Indian Indonesian|Indian]] ([[Sindhi people|Sindhi]]) descent.<ref>[http://www.indoindians.com/rampunjabi.htm "King of Soap Opera"] - Indonesian Indians</ref> His nephew is [[Manoj Punjabi]].<ref name="TH">{{cite news|url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-opinion/sindhi-kings-of-indonesian-entertainment/article5054226.ece |title=Sindhi kings of Indonesian entertainment |date=24 August 2013 |accessdate=26 October 2015 |first=Pallavi |last=Aiyar |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140620123008/http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-opinion/sindhi-kings-of-indonesian-entertainment/article5054226.ece |archivedate=June 20, 2014 }}</ref>
==Career==
===Filmography===
;As producer {{col-begin}} {{col-break}} * ''Special Silencers'' (1979) * ''Bodoh-bodoh mujur'' (1981) * ''Ferocious Female Freedom Fighters'' (1982) <ref>[http://movies2.nytimes.com/gst/movies/filmography.html?p_id=107217 Filmography] - New York Times</ref> * ''Kamp tawanan wanita'' (1983) * ''Itu bisa diatur'' (1984) * ''The Stabilizer'' (1986) * ''Pengantin baru'' (1986) * ''[[Rambu|Pembalasan rambu]]'' (1986) * ''Java Burn'' (1988) * ''[[The Intruder (1986 film)|The Intruder]]'' (1989) * ''Kabut asmara'' (1994) * ''Panji manusia milenium'' (2001) (TV series) * ''Bidadari'' (2001) (TV series) * ''Kiss Kis Ko'' (2004) * ''Buruan cium gue!'' (2004) * ''Satu kecupan'' (2004) {{col-break}} * ''Jatuh cinta lagi'' (2006) * ''Kuntilanak'' (2006) * ''[[I Miss You (film)|Kangen]]'' (''[[I Miss You (film)|I Miss You]]'') (2007) * ''Kuntilanak 2'' (2007) * ''Pulau hantu'' (2007) * ''Kawin kontrak'' (2008) * ''Kuntilanak 3'' (2008) * ''D.O. (Drop Out)'' (2008) * ''Pulau hantu 2'' (2008) * ''Kawin kontrak lagi'' (2008) * ''MBA: Married by Accident'' (2008) * ''Kirun + Adul'' (2009) * ''[[Jamila dan Sang Presiden]]'' (2009) * ''Punk in Love'' (2009) * ''[[Nazar (2009 film)|Nazar]]'' (2009) * ''Toilet 105'' (2010) * ''[[Soekarno: Indonesia Merdeka]]'' {{col-end}} ;As executive producer * ''Petualangan 100 Jam'' (2004) * ''Pesan dari surga'' (2006) ;As writer * ''Perawan rimba'' (1983) * ''Kamp tawanan wanita'' (1983)
==References== <references>
<ref name="dailynews1">{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=DfMaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=HkgEAAAAIBAJ&pg=3192,2976123&dq=raam-punjabi&hl=en|title=Indonesians escape into soaps|last=Brumitt|first=Chris|work=[[Daily News (Bowling Green)|Daily News]]|publisher=[[Associated Press]]|accessdate=27 May 2010}}</ref>
<ref name="asiaimage1">{{cite news|url=http://www.highbeam.com/doc/1G1-106646853.html|title=Larger than life: Raam Punjabi is probably one of Indonesia's best known local production figures, having been responsible for creating and producing many of the country's most popular comedy and drama series.|last=Day|first=Mila|date=September 1, 2002|publisher=Asia Image|accessdate=27 May 2010}}</ref>
</references>
==External links== * {{webarchive |date=2013-01-03 |url=https://archive.is/20130103134657/http://www.hollywood.com/celebs/detail/id/1484515 |title=Raam Punjabi at Hollywood.com}} * [http://imdb.com/name/nm1099515/ Raam Punjabi] at the [[Internet Movie Database]] * [http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_hb3270/is_200209/ai_n7968931] * [http://sctv.co.id/view/137,10266,1,1119632400,1119703546.html]

{{Expand German|Eingetragener Verein|date=October 2018}} [[File:GWUP 01.jpg|thumb|The [[Gesellschaft zur wissenschaftlichen Untersuchung von Parawissenschaften|GWUP]] is an e.{{nnbsp}}V. registered in Germany, but it operates in Austria and Switzerland as well]]
An '''''{{lang|de|eingetragener Verein}}''''' ({{IPA-de|ˈaɪnɡəˌtʁaːɡənɐ fɛʁˈʔaɪn|lang}}, ''registered association'' or ''incorporated association''), abbreviated '''''e.{{nnbsp}}V.''''' ({{IPA-de|ˈeː ˈfaʊ|lang}}), is a legal status for a [[Civil registration|registered]] [[voluntary association]] in [[Germany]]. While any group may be called a ''{{lang|de|Verein}}'', registration as ''{{lang|de|eingetragener Verein}}'' holds many legal benefits because a registered association may legally function as a corporate body ([[juridical person]]) rather than just a group of individuals. The legal status must be mentioned in the name as well.
==Membership==
All natural and legal persons in Germany, including entities such as municipalities, counties and other entities under public law, can form associations and be member of an association. The statutory minimum number of members for forming a registered association is 7.
This means that associations are not limited to private clubs formed by natural persons but have a much broader scope.
==Associations and partnerships==
The [[Bürgerliches Gesetzbuch|Civil Code of Germany]] contains different regulations for registered non-profit and for-profit associations regarded as juridical persons (''{{lang|de|Vereine}}'', articles 21{{ndash}}79) on the one hand and for not necessarily registered associations by contract (''{{lang|de|Gesellschaften}}'', articles 705{{ndash}}740) on the other hand. The Verein is the basic type of a juridical person while the Gesellschaft is dogmatically more a partnership. Due to this theoretical distinction, the concept of Verein is also the legal basis for economic entities such as GmbH and Aktiengesellschaft. They are regulated in separate statutes as special economic associations but bear the same basic features.
In other German-speaking countries such a distinction does not exist. But there may be legal requirements which oblige an association to register itself; for example, in [[Switzerland]] if it must be audited (''{{lang|de|Revisionspflicht}}''). In Austria, all associations are registered in a special register, and having an e.{{nnbsp}}V. in the name is not allowed.<ref>http://www.bmi.gv.at/cms/BMI_Vereinswesen/faq/Frage_01.aspx</ref>
== References ==
{{reflist}}
== Further reading ==
*{{cite web|url=http://www.rechtswoerterbuch.de/recht/e/eingetragener-verein/ |title=Eingetragener Verein |work=Rechtswörterbuch.de |language=German |trans-title=Registered association |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120918041500/http://www.rechtswoerterbuch.de:80/recht/e/eingetragener%2Dverein/ |archivedate=2012-09-18 |df= }}
